alert.note: Alert for Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 7:55PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Another Round of Snow Tonight Through Sunday Night... Much of the Eastern Interior will have 2 to 4 inches of snow tonight through Sunday night. Areas along the Alaska Range near Denali Park could have up to 6 inches of snow. Northeast winds gusting to 20 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow in many areas late tonight and Sunday. Passes and Highway Summits will have winds gusting to 35 mph and low visibility in blowing snow late tonight into Sunday. Snow will taper off Sunday night. In Fairbanks, light snow will develop this evening, with the snowfall picking up after midnight and continuing into Sunday evening. Fairbanks can expect 2 to 3 inches of snow, with most of it falling between midnight tonight and Sunday afternoon. Many roads will be snow covered an slippery by Sunday morning.
